definitions.text: (military) withdrawal of troops to a more favorable position to escape the enemy's superior forces or after a defeat
examples: the disorderly retreat of French troops

definitions.text: a place of privacy; a place affording peace and quiet
(military) a signal to begin a withdrawal from a dangerous position
(military) a bugle call signaling the lowering of the flag at sunset
an area where you can be alone
withdrawal for prayer and study and meditation
examples: the religious retreat is a form of vacation activity

definitions.text: the act of withdrawing or going backward (especially to escape something hazardous or unpleasant)
pull back or move away or backward
examples: The limo pulled away from the curb
The Pope retreats to Castelgondolfo every summer

definitions.text: make a retreat from an earlier commitment or activity
examples: We'll have to crawfish out from meeting with him
He backed out of his earlier promise
The aggressive investment company pulled in its horns
